text: I think he would have
wanted every and he would have thought
of it in terms of men so we have to put
it that way white men uh men to be to
have the freedom to be independent in
their own lives and what that meant to
him was that people could have land and
people would have farms and they would
not be beholden to
wages um from other people who would he
would say would be exploitative of them
um so he would want sort of
self-sufficiency uh was his sort of
Mantra now self-sufficiency and he's got
you know 200 slaves but self-sufficiency
I don't think he he really did believe
that that was going to die out now he
never had any way of saying how it was
going to die out but he thought slavery
was this sort of retrogressive system
you know how you think people it will
wither away at some point uh without any
clear um vision of how that was actually
going to happen but what he wanted was
self-sufficiency uh for the Americans to
spread out west from SE to shining sea
uh maybe hook up with uh Canada and
South America in some sort of Union
really against Europe because he saw
European influences a baleful influence
on America
and um the sort of Old World Kings
fighting one another in Wars you know he
said Peace was his passion he wanted the
end of War um in the world so he thought
that if everybody spread out everybody
had enough um land to take care of
themselves there would be no need for
fighting and there would be and if we
you know left the Europeans behind we
could get out of those kind of dynastic
Wars where um people are always fighting
each other um for Kingdom and so forth
so he wanted peace and prosperity and
land for Americans and he thought that
could be achieved in a sort of simple
yman farmer type world I mean he didn't
think I mean he knew that eventually
society would evolve but the point was
to Stave off the sort of Corruption of a
British style you know factories and
those kinds of things as long as
possible to remain an agrarian society
for as long as we possibly could
